Nicola Pinder ist Gründungspartner der Creatives Loop Ltd (UK) sowie Geschäftsführerin und Partner der Creatives Loop International Ltd. und Co KG in Berlin. Sie hat sich auf die Geschäftsentwicklung in der Film- und Fernsehwirtschaft sowie Digitale Medien und die Organisation und Durchführung von Delegationen und Matching Events spezialisiert. Sie ist bestens vertraut mit den Prozessen in Produktion, Finanzierung, Verkauf und Verleih, die Film, Fernsehen und Digitale Medien bestimmen. Ein professioneller Schwerpunkt ihrer Arbeit ist die enge Verflechtung von Kreativität und Technologie sowie die Vermarktuing des in diesem Spannungsfeld entstehenden wirtschaftlichen Potenzials.

Vor Creatives Loop betreute sie lange Jahre die Kreativkunden bei Strategem, UK. Bei Strategem hat sie in allen Feldern der Außenwirtschaftsförderung gearbeitet (Organisation von Kooperationsveranstaltungen, Außenwirtschaftsberatung für Unternehmen, Entwicklung von internationalen Marktstrategien, Betreuung von Brancheninitiativen.) In ihrer Zeit bei Strategem war sie Clustermanager für ein Cluster von über 90 britischen Unternehmen der Kreativwirtschaft mit einem Arbeitsschwerpunkt in der Internationalisierung dieses Clusters. Über fünf Jahre hat sie die von ihr entwickelte Internationalisierungsstrategie erfolgreich umgesetzt.

Nicola hat bereits eine Vielzahl von Kooperationsveranstaltungen und Workshops zur Geschäftsentwicklung im Auftrag von Industrieverbänden und Organisationen begleitet.Sie hat als Expertin für die Kreativwirtschaft bereits Matchings in Großbritannien, den Niederlanden, Dänemark und Vereinigten Staaten durchgeführt.

speakers.name: AC  Coppens
speakers.biography:
AC Coppens gründete 1998 THE MARKETING CATALYSTS, um innovative und kreative Unternehmen im Bereich Marketingstrategie und Internationalisierung zu beraten. AC hat sich auf Digital Media Unternehmen mit Geschäftsmodellen an der Schnittstelle zwischen Technologie und Kreativität spezialisiert - vorzugsweise in den Bereichen Film, Musik oder Design - die sich der Herausforderung stellen, neue, vor allem internationale Märkte zu erschließen – insbesondere  in Europa, in der Schweiz und in den USA (spezifisch: New York).

Zuvor war AC Head of Communication bei der Herlitz AG, wo sie die strategische Konzeption, Planung, Koordinierung und Kontrolle sämtlicher Kommunikations- und PR-Maßnahmen in 16 Ländern verantwortete. Die von ihr initiierte globale Business-to-business-Kampagne hat den Award des New York Festivals, den Edgar Preis,  den Preis der Deutschen Fachpresse sowie den Deutschen Preis für Kommunikationsdesign erhalten.

Gestartet hat AC ihre berufliche Laufbahn bei der Agentur Dorland/Grey, wo sie das New Business aufgebaut hat.

AC hat in Paris, Oxford und Berlin an der ESCP-Europe internationale BWL studiert, wo sie mit einem European Masters in Management (MBA) abgeschlossen hat.

speakers.name: Mihaela Gladovic
speakers.biography: Seit 2012 moderiert Mihaela Gladovic als Werkstudentin bei ALEX BERLIN verschiedene Formate für TV und Radio, wovon sie ebenfalls einiges selbst inhaltlich betreut und postproduziert. Bevor die Literatur- und Kulturwissenschaftsstudentin wegen ihres Masterstudiums und natürlich wegen der Hauptstadt selbst nach Berlin zog, studierte sie Germanistik und Anglistik in Wuppertal und schrieb für die Filmredaktion von RTL INTERACTIVE. 2009 war sie darüber hinaus im Rahmen eines Praktikums in Kapstadt als Redakteurin bei THE BIG ISSUE SOUTH AFRICA tätig und schloss im gleichen Jahr zwei Auslandssemester an der UNIVERSITY OF LIMERICK im Fach English & New Media an.

speakers.name: McNamee Joe
speakers.biography: Joe McNamee is Executive Director of European Digital Rights, the umbrella organisation for digital civil rights organisations in Europe. He has been working in the internet sector almost continually since 1995 and has a particular interest in issues related to privacy, “voluntary” regulation of citizens by internet companies and the application of human rights law in the online environment.

speakers.name: Saskia Sassen
speakers.biography:
Saskia Sassen is the Robert S. Lynd Professor of Sociology and Co-Chairs The Committee on Global Thought, Columbia University. Her research and writing focuses on globalization (including social, economic and political dimensions), immigration, global cities (including cities and terrorism), the new networked technologies, and changes within the liberal state that result from current transnational conditions.

She is the author of several books. Her forthcoming book is Expulsions: Brutality and Complexity in the Global Economy (Harvard University Press 2014).

She has received diverse awards, from multiple doctor honoris causa to being chosen as one of the Top 100 Global Thinkers by Foreign Policy, Top 100 Thought Leaders by GDI-MIT. In 2013 she was awarded the prestigious Prince of Asturias Award for her contributions to the field of social science.

speakers.name: Nicolas Wöhrl
speakers.biography:
Profession: Dr. Nicolas Wöhrl is a physicist. He joint the Center of Nanointegration (CENIDE) at the University of Duisburg-Essen where he is working at the Nano Energy Technology Center (NETZ). NETZ is an application-focused research project. The aim of the project is to develop materials and also processes which allow nanotechnology to be used in industry – especially focused on energy applications.

 

Passion: Nicolas is a science communicator. He participated in numerous events where current research was presented and explained to the public including science-slams and experimental shows for kids. He is also the founder of the popular scientific podcast “methodisch inkorrekt” where he is biweekly presenting science news for everybody.

 

Believe: Nicolas believes in science and education and he wants to get the society more involved in the wonders of science. He believes that the scientists themselves have the responsibility to bring back the science to the masses.

speakers.name: Sarah Spiekermann
speakers.biography:
Sarah chairs the Institute for Management Information Systems at Vienna University of Economics and Business (WU Vienna). She has published over 70 articles in the area of social acceptance of computer systems. Her main expertise is electronic privacy, disclosure behavior and ethical computing.  Sarah has co-authored US/EU privacy regulation for RFID technology and regularly works as an advisor to companies and governmental institutions, such as the EU Commission and the OECD. Besides this professional engagement she maintains a blog on “The Ethical Machine”, is on the board of the Austrian art & science think-tank GlobArt and supports WU‘s student consultancy company uniforce on the advisory board. Before being tenured in Vienna, Sarah was Assistant Professor at the Institute of Information Systems at Humboldt University Berlin (Germany), Adjunct Research Professor with the Heinz College of Public Policy and Management, Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, USA) and head of the Berlin Research Centre on Internet Economics.

[Foto: Stefan Krempl]

speakers.name: Greta Taubert
speakers.biography: Die Journalistin und freie Autorin berichtet für "Die Zeit", "Cicero", "taz" und die "FAS" von überall dort, wo es unbequem, schmutzig und riskant ist: von Blutrachehäusern in den Albanischen Alpen, von Kinderhändlern im äthiopischen Hochland und Guerillacamps in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. In diesem Jahr erschien ihr Buch "Apokalypse Jetzt! Wie ich mich auf eine neue Gesellschaft vorbereite".

speakers.name: Hannah Wilhelm
speakers.biography:
Dr. Hannah Wilhelm

Wirtschaftsjournalistin Süddeutsche Zeitung 

Hannah Wilhelm ist Jahrgang 1978 und hat am Institut für Kommunikationswissenschaft und Medienforschung in München promoviert. Ihre Ausbildung zur Redakteurin absolvierte sie an der Deutschen Journalistenschule. Sie arbeitete als Finanzredakteurin für Focus Online sowie für das Magazin Börse Online. Seit Ende 2007 schreibt sie nun für die Süddeutsche Zeitung, vor allem für die Geld-Seiten. Sie ist unter anderem verantwortlich für die Interview-Serie „Reden wir über Geld mit …“.

speakers.name: Annalee Newitz
speakers.biography: Annalee Newitz studied at Berkeley, California, was a Knight Science Journalism Fellow at MIT and worked as a political advisor for the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF). Her blog “io9” has become one of the most popular science and sci-fi blogs on the web and is dedicated to science-fiction, technology and pretty much everything else that the future holds for us.

speakers.name: Evgeny Morozov
speakers.biography: Evgeny Morozov is a contributing editor at The New Republic. He is author of "The Net Delusion: The Dark Side of Internet Freedom and To Save Everything" and "To Save Everything, Click Here: The Folly of Technological Solutionism".

speakers.name: Anna Lena Schiller
speakers.biography: After having spent three years at The KaosPilots, a Danish university for creativity and social innovation, I started up her own business. At the core of my work is visual thinking - using pictures and structure to create a common understanding. I specialize in graphic facilitation, real-time visualization (graphic recording) of conferences and also teach visual thinking skills to everyone interested in how to use more pictures and less words.

speakers.name: Viktor  Mayer-Schönberger
speakers.biography: Viktor Mayer-Schönberger is Professor of Internet Governance and Regulation at the Oxford Internet Institute / Oxford University. He is also a faculty affiliate of the Belfer Center of Science and International Affairs at Harvard University. In addition to “Big Data”, Mayer-Schönberger has published eight books (including the awards-winning “Delete: The Virtue of Forgetting in the Digital Age” with Princeton University Press) and is the author of over a hundred articles and book chapters on the information economy.

speakers.name: Ron Deibert
speakers.biography: Ron Deibert is a political scientist and one of the leading Canadian experts for digital technologies, security, and human rights who is able to ask the right people the right questions at the right time. His most recent book, “Black Code”, is an evocative evaluation of the internet world and its citizens.

speakers.name: Alexa Clay
speakers.biography: Alexa Clay is the author The Misfit Economy, a book that explores what business can learn from underground and “deviant” innovation. She is the co-founder of The Human Agency, a collective incubating breakthrough ideas for humanity.

speakers.name: Daniel Bode
speakers.biography: Ich heiße Daniel Bode, bin 18 Jahre alt und besuche zurzeit die Oskar-von-Miller-Schule in Kassel. Dort erarbeite ich die zweijährige höhere Berufsfachschule zum staatlich geprüften Assistenten in Informationstechnik, sowie den theoretischen Teil der Fachhochschulreife. Damit werde ich im Sommer 2014 fertig sein.

speakers.name: Olga Rasulova
speakers.biography: Head of digital marketing in Philips Russia, Consumer and Lifestyle. Focuses on content online projects and integrated digital marketing campaigns. Before joining Philips, headed Edelman digital Russia, focusing  on public engagement, digital communication and social media campaigns.

speakers.name: Anatol Stefanowitsch
speakers.biography: Anatol Stefanowitsch ist Professor für die Struktur des heutigen Englisch an der Freien Universität Berlin. Er gründete das erste deutschsprachige Sprachwissenschaftsblog, das Bremer Sprachblog und bloggt dort unter anderem zu Sprachpurismus, diskriminierender Sprache, Sprachpolitik.

speakers.name: Julian Möller
speakers.biography:
Auszubildener Fachinformatiker Fachrichtung Anwendungsentwicklung bei der quindata GmbH

Berufsschüler an der Oskar-von-Miller Schule

speakers.name: Matthias Huhn
Jarosław Lipszyc
speakers.biography: Jarosław Lipszyc is CEO of the Modern Poland Foundation, board presidium for the Open Education Coalition, committee member of the Citizens of Culture, co-founder of the Stanislaw Brzozowski Association, and audit committee member of the Internet Society of Poland. Before he started working for the Modern Poland Foundation he worked for many years as a journalist, poet and musician, and currently still is an active booster of modern education and open culture. He's an active substantive participant in all projects of the Modern Poland Foundation, a trainer in workshops for teachers, and a lecturer on subjects related to new technology, education and Internet law. Jarosław has participated in social action towards organizing consultations on the implementation of the Register of Banned Websites and Services, was a participant of the debate "Ask the Prime Minister", and debates ACTA and the future of the copyright. He promotes dialogue and cooperation between the NGOs and public administration.

speakers.name: Aram Bartholl
speakers.biography:
Born: 1972, Bremen, Germany Education:UdK - University of the Arts Berlin, 2002 Aram Bartholl's work creates an interplay between internet, culture and reality. The versatile communication channels are taken for granted these days, but how do they influence us? According to the paradigm change of media research Bartholl not just asks what man is doing with the media, but what media does with man. The tension between public and private, online and offline, technology infatuation and everyday life creates the core of his producing. In public interventions and public installations Bartholl examines which and how parts of the digital world can reach back into reality.

Aram Bartholl is a member of the Internet based artist group Free, Art & Technology Lab - F.A.T. Lab. Net politics, the DIY movement and the Internet development in general do play an important role in his work. Beside numerous lectures, workshops and performances he exhibited at MoMA Museum of Modern Art NY, The Pace Gallery NY and Kasseler Kunstverein. Aram Bartholl lives and works in Berlin. He is represented by DAM Gallery Berlin & xpo gallery Paris.

speakers.name: Fachhochschule Potsdam
speakers.biography: Der Studiengang Interfacedesign wurde 2003 an der Fachhochschule Potsdam gegründet und hat seither ein einzigartiges Profil in der deutschen Hochschullandschaft entwickelt. Die Studenten lernen computerbasierte Produkte mit der Lebenswelt des Menschen zu verknüpfen: konzeptionell, praxisnah, experimentell, ästhetisch und verantwortungsbewusst. Ausgehend vom Konzept der forschenden Lehre beteiligen sich Interfacedesign-Studenten bereits in den ersten Semestern an Forschungsprojekten und Industriekooperationen. Sie experimentieren mit Material und Wahrnehmung, denken interdisziplinär und emotional: Interfacedesigner machen aus digitaler Umgebung lebenswerte Heimat.

speakers.name: Guido Kopp
speakers.biography:
Dr. phil. Guido Kopp

Magister Psychologie & Kommunikation (Universität Essen)

Medienpädagogischer Berater des Landes Niedersachsen (2010-2012)

Ausbildung zum systemischen Berater (Niedersächsisches Landesinstitut für schulische Qualitätsentwicklung)

Heilpraktiker für Psychotherapie (HPG)

Kinder-, Jugend- und Familienberater (Paracelsus Schule)

Mitglied im Verband freier Psychotherapeuten

speakers.name: Andrei Soldatov
speakers.biography:
Andrei Soldatov is an investigative journalist and an editor of Agentura.Ru. He began his career as a reporter in 1996 and in September 2000 he launched the Agentura.Ru project, an information hub on intelligence agencies. In September 2010 Andrei Soldatov published a book (with Irina Borogan), titled The New Nobility: The Restoration of Russia’s Security State and the Enduring Legacy of the KGB (PublicAffairs, 2010).

In October 2012 Agentura.Ru, Privacy International and Citizen Lab launched the joint project 'Russia’s Surveillance State'. On October 6, 2013 The Guardian reported the research made by Andrei Soldatov and Irina Borogan over surveillance at the 2014 Winter Olympics.  On January 22, 2014 Soldatov provided a testimony on Russian surveillance practices before the the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs (LIBE Committee) of the European Parliament.

speakers.name: Vanessa Carmicino
speakers.biography: Ex PR professional, former blogger and finally social media enthusiast. Trapped in the Web since the early Nineties. Actually account supervisor and social media manager @Hagakure. Often Tv series binging, sometimes wearing boxing gloves but her best sport performance is sitting on the sofa listening to music records: her real name is SlackerV
speakers.position: Social Media Manager and Account Supervisor

speakers.name: Glyn  Moody
speakers.biography:
Glyn Moody is a journalist, blogger and speaker. He writes about digital rights, copyright and patents on Techdirt, while his blog is about open source, open data and open culture. After gaining two degrees in mathematics from Cambridge University, Moody entered business journalism before specialising in the field of computers in 1983.

He started writing and lecturing about business use of the Internet in early 1994, and about open source in 1995. In 1997 he wrote the first mainstream feature about GNU/Linux and free software, which appeared in Wired magazine.

His book, "Rebel Code: Linux and the Open Source Revolution" - the only detailed history of free software written so far - was published in 2001. "Digital Code of Life: How Bioinformatics is Revolutionising Science, Medicine and Business" appeared in 2004, and explores the rise and importance of digital genomics.

speakers.name: Gesche Joost
speakers.biography: Gesche Joost ist Professorin für Designforschung an der Universität der Künste Berlin und leitet das Design Research Lab. Gemeinsam mit internationalen Partnern entwickelt sie Forschungs- und Lehrprojekte zu den Themen Mensch-Maschine-Interaktion, zu Gender- und Diversity-Aspekten in der Technologie-Entwicklung sowie zur sozialen Nachhaltigkeit und gesellschaftlichen Partizipation. 2006 wurde sie als einer der »100 Köpfe von Morgen« im Rahmen der Initiative der Bundesregierung »Deutschland - Land der Ideen« ausgezeichnet, 2009 erhielt sie den Nachwuchs-Wissenschaftspreis des Regierenden Bürgermeisters von Berlin. Sie ist Vorsitzende der Deutschen Gesellschaft für Designtheorie und -forschung e.V. und Mitglied des Vorstands der Technologiestiftung Berlin. 2013 war sie im Rahmen des Wahlkamps Mitglied im Kompetenzteam des Kanzlerkandidaten Peer Steinbrück. Seit 2014 ist sie als "Digital Champion" für die Bundesregierung im Europaparlament nominiert.

speakers.name: Hannah Fry
speakers.biography: Dr. of fluid dynamics, researcher of complexity theory and all round bad-ass.

speakers.name: Markus Schaffrin
speakers.biography: Markus Schaffrin ist diplomierter Informatiker und Geschäftsbereichsleiter Mitglieder Services beim eco - Verband der deutschen Internetwirtschaft e.V. Schwerpunkte seiner Tätigkeit sind die eco Cyber Security Services inklusive der Projektleitung der Initiative-S. Er ist Mitglied im Steuerkreis der Initiative "IT-Sicherheit in der Wirtschaft" des BMWi, sowie der Unterarbeitsgruppe 3 (Providerverantwortung) der AG 4 "Vertrauen, Datenschutz und Sicherheit im Internet" des IT-Gipfels. Zu den aktuellen Themenfeldern der Internetsicherheit  und -wirtschaft hält er seit einigen Jahren regelmäßig Vorträge.

speakers.name: Carla Kirmis
speakers.biography:
Carla Kirmis arbeitet seit Beginn dieses Jahres als Wirtschaftsberaterin in der Wirtschaftsabteilung ProChile in der Chilenischen Botschaft in Berlin. Zuvor hat sie drei Jahre lang in Santiago de Chile gelebt und war im Außenministerium Chiles als Expertin für den Europäischen Markt zuständig. Sie ist studierte Wirtschaftsgeographin der LMU München. Sie spricht fließend deutsch, spanisch und englisch.

Auf der re:publica 2014 wird sie das Programm "Start-Up Chile" vorstellen, das early stage Start-Ups die Möglichkeit bietet mit der Förderung der Chilenischen Regierung ihr Unternehmen in Chile zu gründen oder weiterzuentwickeln. Es warten 40.000 USD non-equity Kapital, ein soft landing Programm und die pulsierende Metropole Santiago de Chile auf euch!

speakers.name: Christian Heise
speakers.biography: Christian Heise is a Research Associate at the Centre for Digital Cultures (CDC) af­fi­lia­ted to Leu­pha­na Uni­ver­si­ty Lüne­burg, Member of Board of the German Chapter of the Open Knowledge Foundation and Co-Founder of freifunk.net, a non-commercial open initiative to support free radio networks. He is currently doing research on new forms of scholarly communication in the digital age and writing his dissertation on the development of Open Science in Germany. Until 2012 he worked as a Business Development Manager at DIE ZEIT and the German Press Agency (DPA).

speakers.name: Gabriela Agustini
speakers.biography: Gabriela Agustini discovered the potential of the P2P network while studying Communication at the University of São Paulo (USP), in Brazil, and has  worked with major media groups in the country for the last 10 years. Since then, she has organized and participated in various projects, meetings and groups about the potential of new technologies for the transformation of society. Her experience ranges from the public sector to small startups and private companies.  She formed part of the House of Digital Culture, in São Paulo, where she worked as a curator and executive director of CulturaDigital.Br International Festival held in Brazil. She is currently a Professor of Culture and Technology at two universities in Rio de Janeiro, associate and director of innovation at Temple Coworking, entrepreneruship hub with over 200 people in Rio, where she coordinates the makerspace – a space dedicated to the sharing of knowledge and the innovative development of tools from carpentry to robotics.

speakers.name: Jovani Ntabgoba
speakers.biography:
Born and raised in Rwanda and Uganda, Jovani Ntabgoba is a Telecom Engineer and the General Manager of kLab (Knowledge Laboratory). kLab is a co-working incubator like Tech Space in Kigali-Rwanda,  sponsored and run by both Rwanda Government and Private Sector Federation.

Prior to joining kLab, Jovani was a TVET Consultant with Rwanda Private Sector Federation and a Tech Analyst with a local media house.

speakers.name: Yann LE BEUX
speakers.biography: Yann Le Beux is currently working as a Catalyst for CTIC Dakar, the first IT and Mobile Technology Incubator of Senegal. He is in charge for advising high-growth entrepreneurs on their strategy and business model and he is also responsible for developing the incubator long term strategy and building key partnerships with local and international stakeholders. Yann was previously in charge of the mentoring program for MoovJee, the leading organization in France dedicated to young entrepreneurs. He has also served for few years within the Innovation and Entrepreneurship Department of the French Embassy in the US. Based in Boston, he was in charge of creating, implementing and managing a new initiative to help the most innovative French start-ups accelerate their development in the US. He co-funded several projects in the US including one startup and the GATE initiative to transfer technologies from US universities to startups in Africa. He also worked and lived in the UK and Belgium. He holds a Master in Engineering and Innovation Management and followed an Entrepreneurship training at Harvard University. Yann is passionate by technology and social entrepreneurship, he reads about geopolitics and he loves travels, great food and basketball.

speakers.name: Marcello Bonventre
speakers.biography:
Rundfunkjournalist mit langjähriger On- und Off-Air-Erfahrung bei Bremen Vier, der jüngsten Welle von Radio Bremen. Seit 2007 auch dann und wann als Vertretungskorrespondent fürs ARD Hörfunk-Studio Rom unterwegs.

Zur Zeit Redaktionsleitung der "Digitale Garage". Aktuelles Projekt: wochenwebschau.

War um die Jahrhundertwende herum Moderator von Sendungen, die als Multimediamagazine bezeichnet wurden. Das klang damals noch ganz hip. Ehrlich.

speakers.name: Sophie Lamprou
speakers.biography: Starting with an idea in 2008, then spending almost 3 years in the Impact Hub in Madrid, Sophie with her best friend Dimitri is setting up the Impact Hub in Athens since 2013. Impact Hub Athens is part of an international network locally connected, whose role is to inspire, connect and enable individuals and institutions around the world to sustainably impact society. In a context where the future emerges and the established is evolving, they are working through a creative destruction to create a solid ecosystem that impulses social inovation in different sectors with different actors.

speakers.name: Jay Fajardo
speakers.biography:
Jay is a serial tech entrepreneur whose first startup was coding and selling business software while in high school in the late 80's. His last startup cycle was Wi-Fi hotspot network Airborne Access, founded in 2002, and sold it to PLDT in 2008. 

He is currently founder and CEO of Ruby development shop Proudcloud, and the Program Director of Launchgarage, a startup accelerator based in Manila that funds and mentors early stage startups through a 6 month program. He is an organiser of Startup Weekend Manila, runs the regular ROOFCAMP innovators and disruptors meetup, and #failbeers where founders share their failure stories and their learnings.

Jay holds roles as director, advisor, and mentor to various tech startups in Manila and regularly speaks on Lean Startup, Agile Deveopment, and the South East Asian Startup Ecosystem.

speakers.name: Anirudh Narla
speakers.biography: Anirudh Narla is currently working as the Director of Operations at the Meltwater Incubator. Anirudh is a tech startup enthusiast who did his bachelors in Computer Engineering and Entrepreneurship in Singapore and is currently helping Entrepreneurs in Ghana build their billion-dollar company. During his free time he is seeking out new adventures, travelling and trying his hands at photography.

speakers.name: Alexander Mankowsky
speakers.biography:
Alexander Mankowsky, Zukunftsforschung, Daimler AG Alexander Mankowsky, geb. 1957 in  Berlin, schloss sein Studium von Soziologie, Philosophie und Psychologie an der FU 1984 als Diplom-Soziologe ab.  Vier Jahre lang arbeitete er daraufhin mit Kindern und Jugendlichen als Einzelfallhelfer in praktischer Therapie und Lebenshilfe, bis ihn der Zeitgeist packte und zur ‚Artificial Intelligence (AI)‘ führte. In einer von Daimler damals gegründeten Universität mit dem Fokus AI erwarb er nach heftigem programmieren in Lisp und Prolog den Titel des ‚Knowledge Engineers‘.

1989 begann Alex seine Tätigkeit im Forschungsinstitut von Daimler in Berlin. 

Sein derzeitiges Arbeitsgebiet ist die gestaltende Zukunftsforschung: Technische und soziale Innovationen sollen zu wünsch- und machbaren Zukunftsvisionen verbunden werden. An der Gestaltung der Zukunft arbeitet Alex stark vernetzt mit den Kreativen bei Daimler. Seit 7 Jahren ist er in Sindelfingen, nahe an Advanced Design und Engineering.

links.title: Daimler Future Talk | Wie utopisch ist die Zukunft?

speakers.name: Gregor Martynus
speakers.biography:
Gregor is a freelance software developer and Designer, born near Krakow, raised in Frankfurt, currently living with his wife in Zurich and commuting a lot to Berlin. He works remotely and usually with teams spread around the world, for both professional and voluntary work.

In 2012, an article catched his attention "From Kenya to Madagascar: The African tech-hub boom" [bbc]. It showed a map of 20+ tech hubs spread around the African Sub Saharan countries. Given the fact that their seem to be tech communities, he wondered why he didn't hear about any yet. So he spread the article on twitter, suggesting to change that. Many friends responded, the idea of the AfricaHackTrip was born, and it came to reality in September/October 2013 with a group of 9 European designers, developers and bloggers.

When not planning the next trip, he works on Hoodie, an open plattform to enable as many people as possible to create simple applications, as well as minutes.io, a very simple app to track results of meetings.

links.title: [bbc] From Kenya to Madagascar: The African tech-hub boom
Hoodie – very fast web app development
minutes.io – the simplest meeting tool since pen &amp; paper

speakers.name: Markus Hündgen
speakers.biography: Geboren 1979 in Bonn, aufgewachsen im schönen Sauerland. Studium der Regionalwissenschaften (Japan) und Sozialwissenschaften, zeitgleich freier Journalist. Volontariat bei der WAZ-Mediengruppe/Westfalenpost. Video-Redakteur bei DerWesten.de, dort Ressortleiter bis 2010. Produzent, Autor, Videojournalist und Gesellschafter bei Blinkenlichten Produktionen (u.a. "Elektrischer Reporter"/ZDF) bis Mitte 2012. Trainer und Dozent u.a. ard.zdf medienakademie, diverse Journalistenschulen, Hochschulen in Deutschland, Österreich und Schweiz. Co-Gründer des Videocamp (2009) und des Deutschen Webvideopreises (2011). Seit 2011 Geschäftsführer der European Web Video Academy GmbH. Seit 2007 @Videopunk.

speakers.name: Markos Lemma
speakers.biography: Born in Ethiopia in 1984. Markos specialized in ICT consultancy in Ethiopia. He co-founded the iceaddis innovation hub. He's currently working as a community manager. He's a coordinator on a research program on literacy, a project running by MIT, OLPC & Tufts University with a direct supervision of Nicholas Negroponte, Dr. Cynthia Breazeal & Maryanne Wolf. He Organizes Barcamp Ethiopia once a year. Barcamp Ethiopia is the biggest tech community event in Ethiopia. He loves the active tech community and organized different events. He is a collaborator, a blogger (Author for Global Voices) and a social media expert. He Mainly blogs and speaks about social media, mobile technology in Africa, green tech, and technology innovations.

speakers.name: Jörg Dörnemann
speakers.biography: Dr. Jörg Dörnemann ist seit 2010 Geschäftsführer von epubli, einer Plattform für Self-Publishing und Print-on-Demand aus Berlin-Kreuzberg. Er bewegt sich schon seit langem an der Schnittstelle von “alten” und “neuen” Medien: Nach seiner Tätigkeit als Strategieberater bei der Boston Consulting Group war er Director Stategy & Research bei MTV Networks. 2007 wechselte er ins Führungsteam von Holtzbrinck Digital.

speakers.name: Tom Hillenbrand
speakers.biography:
Tom (41) is a bestselling novelist and business columnist. He publishes thrillers and mystery novels - his latest novel "Drohnenland" (Drone Country) is a sci-fi thriller about mass surveillance. Tom's latest non-fiction project, together with Konrad Lischka, is the coffee table book "Drachenväter" (Dragonfathers), a detailed history of role playing games and their impact on contemporary culture.

Tom holds degrees in political science and economics from Duisburg University. Before going freelance, he worked as a reporter, correspondent and desk editor for Spiegel Online, Business Punk, Financial Times Deutschland and others.

speakers.name: Dr. Thomas Fricke
speakers.biography: Thomas's long and illustrious career in DevOps management gives him an intimate understanding of how IT systems support business operations. Today he is a partner at the Endocde AG and adds more than 25 years of experience in Software Development and Data Center Management to the track record of the company. With his keen understanding of complex systems, he designs environments to build fast, maintainable and reliable automated delivery chains and highly-available distributed database environments.

links.title: Data Center Technology revisited 2014: Open Source is everywhere

speakers.name: Mirko Boehm
speakers.biography:
Mirko Boehm is the CEO of Endocode, where he specializes in consulting to and mentoring small to large businesses on complex software development endeavors, the use of open source products and methods in organizations, and software-related  issues of business strategy and intellectual property.
With almost 20 years of software engineering experience and 15 years in product ownership, leadership and management functions, he today frequently presents at conferences, and teaches at Berlin's Technical University as a visiting professor. And he codes, too.

links.title: Blog: A mix of Open Source community governance, political economics and hacking.

speakers.name: Ratozamanana Andriankoto Harinjaka
speakers.biography:
Harinjaka Andriankoto RATOZAMANANA is a Social Entrepreneur and Pioneer in New Media in Madagascar. He is co-founder and CEO of Habaka -Madagascar Innovation Hub, a nonprofit organisation which lead Madagascar’s youth in Web and Mobile Technology. Habaka's vision emphasizes new media and technology tools and their use in solving issues of concern to all in Madagascar and its continent, including the most marginalized and impoverished. Ratozamanana is an international consultant who understands how technology can be applied to the purposes of the development of his contient. For example, he was member of ATPS (African Technology Policy Network) a multi-disciplinary network of researchers, practitioners and policy makers that promotes science, technology and innovation (STI) for African Development. Ratozamanana came into international fame after being selected by TED (www.ted.com), which stands for Technology Entertainment and Design as inaugural fellow. TED is often referred to as “the Davos of ideas and communication.” As a TED Fellow in Arusha, Tanzania in 2007, and also TED Fellow in Long Beach California in 2009, Andriankoto Harinjaka Ratozamanana was recognized as an outstanding young world leader who demonstrated achievement and potential, especially in improving the lives of young people in his local communities.
You can find him on Twitter at @harinjaka

Specialties: New Media, Development, Politics

speakers.name: Juliane Leopold
speakers.biography: Juliane Leopold, 1983 geboren in Halle(Saale), studierte Publizistik- und Kommunikationswissenschaft sowie Filmwissenschaft in Berlin. Seit 2012 ist sie Social Media-Redakteurin bei ZEIT ONLINE und der ZEIT. Davor war sie bei der Neuen Zürcher Zeitung, der Schweiter Website local.ch sowie der Wochenzeitung der Freitag. Zum Journalismus kam sie über das Bloggen und Twitter. Sie glaubt, dass Social Media für Journalismus keine Bedrohung, sondern eine riesige Chance ist - und das auch ohne Katzenvideos.

links.title: About me (Links zu Artikeln von Juliane)

speakers.name: Elizaveta Barsegova
speakers.biography: Born in St. Petersburg, Elizaveta Barsegova graduated from the Public Relations department of St. Petersburg University. Studied in Linkoping University (Sweden) and Leibniz University Hannover (Germany). Worked for the International Art Festival for Children with Limited Capabilities and directed 4 additions of Maker Weekend Festival. Currently she settled down in Berlin, developing betahaus| Education - an Independent Education Platform, empowering people to learn Tech, Design and Business.

speakers.name: Moushira Elamrawy
speakers.biography:
Design and technology consultant, with multidisciplinary experience ranging between ecological building techniques, interaction design, community building and open source advocacy.   Trained as an architect with hands on experience in building with local communities in Sinai of Egypt and the Sahara or Morocco.  I recently finished masters in interaction design from the Institue of Advanced Architecture of Cataluña of UPC in Barcelona,  where I currently develop systems for art and non-profit purposes.

I am proud Linux user, and a happy advocate to free access to knowledge.  I served as a consultant project manager to the global department of the Wikimedia foundation. Am also an advocate to GMin Foundation's to innovation labs project in Sierra Leone.

speakers.name: Stefania Druga
speakers.biography:
Stefania Druga: founder of Hackidemia and Afrimakers, former Googler and graduate from an international Erasmus Mundus master of Media Engineering for Education (France, Spain, Portugal). In the summer of 2012 was also the Education Teaching Fellow at Singularity University at NASA where she advised and coached 80 students from 36 countries. In the past 3 months she travelled in 8 African countries and trained local teams of makers to design and create hands-on projects that could solve local challenges like access to electricity, clean water, health. 

@Stefania_druga

speakers.name: Victor Nyang'a
speakers.biography: Victor Augustine Nyng’a is the founder and CEO of Victronix™ Co. Ltd. He is a self educated electronics engineer. He hold first grade Industrial Electronics Certificate from Vocation Training Authority –Tanzania. He had worked as Electronics Instructor at Akeri Vocation Center and later as computer instructor at Assumption School all in Arusha. He is good at hardware designing and has developed a number of technologies including PA System and egg incubator controller. He is currently developing Remotely Monitored Multiple Cell-phones Solar Charger for off-grid areas in Africa and a Multi-Species Mushroom Growing System with controlled environment for year round all weather production. He is also a consultant of technical students and recently in Partnership with Buni Hub, at Dar es Salaam, has started the Make Fellows Hardware Community to helps hardware enthusiasts and technical students to learn hands-on and help each other learn fast by sharing their knowledge.

speakers.name: Wilhelm Oddo
speakers.biography: A  is the founder of NLab, a small local community hub, for primary school, secondary and university students, also a co-founder of bribed a mobile app which help drivers pay less bribe in the places they are.

speakers.name: Fua Tse
speakers.biography:
Born and bred Cameroonian, I was raised in the English town of Bamenda. As a teenager, I had a passion for video games and was always top in challenges. Over time, I developed curiosity in how those games were developed and that is how I gained interest in programming and then software development.

While a student in the university, I was already a junior developer at Afro-Vision, a software development company a key person in my life today, Valery Colong. As we were in the same department, we had many things in common and spoke a lot.

After my BSc in Mathematics, Valery and I decided to start up a venture. No capital, relatively no experience, being in Cameroon, you can phantom the numerous challenges of these young men. This drove us to meet Bill Zimmerman who was then a Peace Corps volunteer in Cameroon. Together, we started what is known today as ActivSpaces – (African Centre for Technology, Innovation and Ventures) with the primary objective of attracting innovative ideas and providing the very basic nursery in which these ideas can thrive.

Zinger Systems is the venture Valery and I eventually started immediately benefited from all ActivSpaces offered us and today, it is an IT Consulting Company with a host of products on the shelf. It is also a partner to VC4Africa (Venture Capital for Africa), the leading match-making platform for Venture Capitalists and Venture owners in Africa.

I am passionate about technology, entrepreneurship, accelerator programs and how to raise funds so as to make it even easier for ideas in ActivSpaces to thrive and become independent ventures.

speakers.name: Tiemo Ehmke
speakers.biography: Tiemo Ehmke is a facilitator and consultant in the border areas of industry, science and civil society. Among other subjects, he studied cultural management with an emphasis on culture and the economy and has worked as a conference manager, company spokesman, author and producer.In the area of development cooperation, he now focuses on the development of icebauhaus, a hub for innovation devoted to the issues of innovation, collaborative methods and the promotion of social entrepreneurship.He is also founder of SEPIA-Institute for Textile Arts.

speakers.name: Mazen Helmy
speakers.biography:
Dubbed a “prodigy” by Forbes in their recent “30 Most Promising Young Entrepreneurs in Africa” article, Mazen Helmy is no doubt a figure to watch. The business magazine wrote:

“27 year-old Mazen Helmy is the founder of The District, one of the first co-working spaces in Egypt and one of the few in the region. The District provides an inspiring workspace (sitting on a total area of almost 1000 square meters) for entrepreneurs and freelancers. Helmy founded the company in 2011.”

speakers.name: Sebastian  Basedow
speakers.biography: Sebastian Basedow, 40 Jahre alt, ist Projekteiter und Berater in strategischen Fragen bei Zebralog. Er beschäftigt sich seit zehn Jahren mit Methoden zur Verwaltungsmodernisierung und Bürgerbeteiligung. 2005 absolvierte er eine Fortbildung „Modernisierung des Staates“ an der Fernuniversität Hagen. Er besitzt umfangreiche Kenntnisse über Aufbau- und Ablaufstrukturen des Öffentlichen Sektors und hat Erfahrung mit der Gestaltung dialogorientierter Verfahren und der sinnvollen Nutzung von Internet und Social Media. Als Mitbegründer und Vorstand des gemeinnützigen Vereins „Netzdemokraten e.V.“ engagiert er sich für die demokratiefördernde Nutzung des Internets. Sebastian Basedow ist Mitglied im Government 2.0 Netzwerk Deutschland e.V.

speakers.name: Frederic Tape
speakers.biography:
Frederic Tapé is a budding entrepreneur from Abidjan with ventures in new media, the arts and web marketing.

He founded AMN [Africaincorp Media network] and co-owns Inpulsion Web Agency, through Which he is able to offer media and tech solutions to individuals, enterprises and institutions.

To be a bridge among stakeholders, markets and creative individuals is at the core of his personal & business philosophy. The AMN Coworking Space created to be this place of meeting, inspiration and business launch, now a member of the Afrilabs network, will seek to be of a Greater impact on the business and creative community.

speakers.name: Andreas Wichmann
speakers.biography: Andreas is taking ideas and turning them into successful projects. His focus is on the delivery - and he leads the way to the goal in understandable steps. After many years with a hand in both engineering and business development, he has developed exceptionally strong skills as an expert in product development and communication. He excels in bringing people together, managing the performance as a group and delivering high quality results to the clients. Andreas was the project lead for many client projects but also for free and self-initiated projects. Today he is expert at Endocode AG for collaboration processes.

links.title: Blog post: The power of asking

speakers.name: Tolu Agunbiade
speakers.biography: Tolu Agunbiade is the Community Manager at Co-creation Hub (CcHub) Nigeria. She is responsible for encouraging and facilitating conversations and relationships with members and partners of the CcHub community. Having worked in the IT industry for a handful of years, she has developed skills (in and outside of academia) in taking products from idea stage to finished result in record time while paying keen attention to details. She believes in the power of technology to improve lives and simplify processes and is constantly researching new ways to achieve this. When she's not perfecting her world domination plans, Tolu can be found nose deep in a book (especially anything by Stephen King), video gaming or pretending to write.

speakers.name: Clarisse Iribagiza
speakers.biography:
Clarisse Iribagiza is HeHe’s CEO and is in charge of overseeing the implementation of the company’s overall strategy.

A computer Engineer with up to 5 years experience in Software Engineering, she co-founded HeHe Limited while in her 3rd year at the Kigali Institute of Science and Technology.

 

She is also a Think Tank member of World Entrepreneurship Forum and the World Economic Forum’s Global Shapers, Kigali Chapter and actively engages in promoting tech entrepreneurship through the iHills, Rwanda’s youth ICT association which she helped start up and is the current vice president as well as the Girls in ICT network.  

 

Clarisse is the inaugural winner of the Inspire Africa Entrepreneurship reality TV show (2012) that brought together 24 young brilliant minds from East Africa to compete in the Apprentice-like TV show that saw her walk away with 50,000USD of business growth capital.

speakers.name: John Matogo
speakers.biography:
I am the Manager of @iBizAfrica, the Incubator Centre at Strathmore University as well as an Instructor in the Faculty of Information Technology. I am interested in the application of technology in educational environments and in entrepreneurship.

I hold a Bachelor of Science (Hons) Degree from the University of Nairobi, a Master of Science in Information Systems and currently pursuing a Masters Business Administration at
Strathmore University. I am a Council member of the Free and Open Source Foundation for Africa (FOSSFA), Project Management Institute, IEEE and recently chair of the Computer Society (Kenya Chapter).


My interests include: ICTs in education, ICT4d, Free & Open source software, Innovation & entrepreneurship. I enjoy connecting with new people, travelling, exploring new ideas and trying out new methods. I look at learning

speakers.name: Ahmed Bastawy
speakers.biography:
Ahmed Bastawy is a social engineer who believes that informal education can mediate the gap between academia and private sector. He is a facilitator who is passionate about applying new experiential learning techniques and practical training methodologies.

In 2011, he founded Ro2yaty Training Agency to support social initiatives and enterprises in Alexandria. One year ago, he initiated icealex (innovation, collaboration and entrepreneurship) hub to establish an enabling ecosystem for action-oriented minds co-creating sustainable solutions for local challenges.

He is mainly concerned by innovation in making, and social responsibility in entrepreneurship.

speakers.name: Richard Zulu
speakers.biography:
Richard Zulu is a founder and lead at Outbox, a community-led coworking space did Provides support to startups, creatives, techies 

and business professionals in Uganda to turn ideas into sustainable Their Work (www.outbox.co.ug).

Richard Has been running Outbox for one year and six months now, supporting up to 6 startups and reaching up to 900 people falling on did time. He Has been able to close partnerships with Samsung, Deloitte 

and Google, who ran ran thus offer support to the startup community through Outbox.

Prior to starting Outbox, he worked at Makerere University as a Network Administrator at the Directorate for ICT Support (dicts). 

Richard Zulu is now an Acumen Fellow for the East Africa class of 2014.

http://ug.linkedin.com/in/richardzulu/

speakers.name: Bilal Ghalib
speakers.biography: Bilal Ghalib works to spread hope by sharing the inspiring thought that together we have the ability to participate in creating a beautiful future. By facilitating the development of Hackerspaces in the Middle East Bilal connects open source, rapid prototyping technologies and most importantly passionate people who will together make tomorrow better. You can follow him at @bilalghalib and http://gemsi.org

speakers.name: Francis Chiwunda
speakers.biography:
Francis Chiwunda is a young Zimbabwean with a great passion for finance and Technology entrepreneurship on the African continent. He majored in finance and was awarded a CFA (chartered financial Analyst ) scholarship by the CFA institute.

He founded the African Chapter of the Kairos Society; setting it up in 5 African countries. Francis co-founded FounderBus/StartupBus Africa and led the African-based planning and operations of the progam. Among his recent entrepreneurial activity, he co-founded and built funeral.ly  - an online funeral event management platform, which directly emerged from the first edition of the bus in 2013. For his work, he has been recognised by many organisations and summits - amongst them; One Young World, South American Business Forum, Kairos Society and Ihave Foundation.

speakers.name: Claudia Valladares
speakers.biography:
Claudia is a social entrepreneur passionate to make a difference in our world. She is co-founder and director of the Impact Hub Caracas. She has more than fourteen (14) years of experience in the financial sector in LatinAmerica (Citi NY, Citi Venezuela, Banesco), the last eight (8) years have been dedicated to microfinance in Venezuela (Banca Comunitaria Banesco) and she has more than 20 years of developing programs and intitiatives within the public, private and third sector (NGOs) in favoring the low income families and the less fortunate segments of our society.

She was awarded “Social Entrepreneur of the Year 2010” in Venezuela by Schwab Foundation of the World Economic Forum and Fundación Venezuela Sin Límites, as well as “Outstanding Social Entrepreneur in Venezuela” in 2011 by Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship and the World Economic Forum; “World Young Leader” of the BMW Foundation since 2011; she was nominated among the Top 100 most Successful Managers in Venezuela by Gerente Magazine in 2012 and 2008, among other awards.

She has a Systems Engineer degree from Universidad Metropolitana, an MBA from Loyola University Chicago, a Master of Finanzas from IESA and she is currently studying the Creative Leadership Program at THNK The Amsterdam School of Creative Leadership. She has completed executive courses in Microfinance, Social Entrepreneurship and Corporate Social Responsibility at Harvard Business School, Harvard Kennedy School, INCAE and INSEAD Business School. Claudia also loves to play tennis, cooking, art, singing and music.

If you ask her what is the impact that she would like to create in the world, she will answer without hesitation: to defeat poverty!

speakers.name: Andrea Goetzke
speakers.biography:
Andrea Goetzke ist Kulturproduzentin und Kuratorin/Organisatorin von Veranstaltungen. Zu ihren aktuellen Aktivitäten zählen z.B. das Torstraßen Festival und die Konferenz der Berlin Music Week. Andrea ist Gründungsmitglied und im Vorstand des all2gethernow e.V., Plattform für neue Strategien in Musikkultur und Musikwirtschaft. Mit all2gethernow hat sie zu Anfang 2014 den Music Pool Berlin eröffnet, ein Projekt das die musikwirtschaftliche Expertise in Berlin für interessierte Musikschaffende in Beratungsgesprächen und Workshops verfügbar macht. Als Teil von newthinking, beschäftigt sie sich seit vielen Jahren mit Digitalkultur und Open Source Ansätzen. Andrea macht eine Free Culture Radio Show auf reboot.fm und organisiert Konzerte und weitere Aktivitäten.

Andrea Goetzke is cultural producer and curator/organizer of various events. Among her current projects are Torstraßen Festival and the Berlin Music Week conference. Andrea is co-founder and board member of all2gethernow e.V., platform for new strategies in music culture and music business. With all2gethernow, she collaborates on running Music Pool Berlin, a project that pools expertise in the music business in Berlin and makes it available for musicians and others working with music. As part of the agency newthinking, Andrea has worked on issues of digital culture and open source approaches for many years. Andrea hosts a free culture radio show on reboot.fm and organizes concerts and other activities.

speakers.name: Eric Eitel
speakers.biography: Eric Eitel berät Tech- und Kulturprojekte bei ihrer strategischen Kommunikation mit der Außenwelt. Eine persönliche Schwäche hat er für Startups, insbesondere, wenn sie sich mit der Zukunft des Musik-Geschäfts oder Musikkultur befassen. Eric engagiert sich als Vorstand für den nichtkommerziellen Musik-Think-Tank all2gethernow e.V., mit  dem er das Projekt Music Pool Berlin gegründet hat. Zurzeit kuratiert er gemeinsam mit newthinking die Fachkonferenz WORD! der Berlin Music Week 2014. Eric twittert obsessiv als @alias_eitel und schreibt als freier Autor für Netz- und Musikfachpublikationen. In seiner Freizeit legt er gerne Schallplatten in Bars auf.

speakers.name: Katina Sostmann
speakers.biography: Katina Sostmann has been working as a product-, process- and interaction designer in an academic and commercial context for more than 7 years and holds the position as design lead at IXDS. Since the completion of her studies at the Universität der Künste Berlin, Katina works as a freelance designer in the areas of user-centered product and interaction design for international clients from different sectors. From 2009 to 2011 she worked as the art director for ART+COM. With the help of interdisciplinary teams she realized projects such as exhibitions, representations and visitor’s centers as integrated, holistic productions. Alongside her freelancing commitment, she has been teaching and researching since 2008. She works as an artist assistant to the project group for interactive systems headed by professor Burkhard Schmitz, which operates in the area of tension between digital and physical design. Simultaneously she also works as a visiting professor at the CdK in Hangzhou, China in the courses industrial design and visual communication.

speakers.name: Rene Parker
speakers.biography:
René Parker is the Director of RLabs an International Living Lab movement with a strong focus on Community-driven Innovation and Social Change. RLabs currently have activities in Africa, United Kingdom, Europe, Asia and South America. She is actively involved in the RLabs Academy and responsible for many of the training programmes with a strong focus on Innovation and Creativity as well as Social and Digital Media. She is responsible for the Women in ICT sector at RLabs. She is also a sought after speaker with a strong focus on empowering women through technology. This passion led her to be the co-founder of a South African award winning Science and Technology blog "She's The Geek" that provides training and consulting on anything technology related. She loves exploring new gadgets and is a devoted Apple fan. Rene is also an inaugural board member of the Living Labs in Southern Africa (LLiSA) network where she fulfills the portfolio of Capacity Building and Community Development as well as Communications. Four things her RLabs team in Cape Town say about her: passionate, kind, motivated and patient.

Tel:            +276991453

Email:         rene@rlabs.org

Twitter:       @reneparker

Skype:       reneparker

Facebook: Rene Petersen Parker

Google:      rene.parker1977@gmail.com

Website:    www.rlabs.org

speakers.name: Andre Meister
speakers.biography:
Andre begleitet netzpolitik.org seit seinen Anfängen und bloggt seit 2007 mehr oder weniger regelmäßig mit. Anfang 2012 konnte er dieses Hobby zum Beruf machen.

Er hat in Berlin Sozialwissenschaften studiert und auch dort netzpolitische Themen bearbeitet. Er begleitet diverse netzpolitische Zusammenhänge wie AK Vorrat, AK Zensur und CCC. Den Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. hat er auch mitbegründet.

Außerdem arbeitet er als System-Administrator.

speakers.name: Richard Gutjahr
speakers.biography: Richard Gutjahr arbeitet als freier Mitarbeiter für die ARD, moderiert beim BR und WDR Fernsehen. Daneben schreibt er regelmäßig als Kolumnist für die Münchner Abendzeitung und den Berliner Tagesspiegel. Er bloggt unter gutjahr.biz.

speakers.name: Julia Kloiber
speakers.biography: Julia Kloiber arbeitet als Projektleiterin für die Open Knowledge Foundation Deutschland (seit 2012) und ist im Digitale Gesellschaft e.V. aktiv. Sie beschäftigt sich mit Projekten rund um die Themen freies Wissen, Open Data, Netzpolitik und Design. Von 2005 bis 2011 hat sie in New York City und Berlin freiberuflich an Projekten im Bereich online Marketing, Kampagnenkonzeption und Videoproduktion gearbeitet.

speakers.name: Jeanette Hofmann
speakers.biography: Dr. Jeanette Hofmann ist Politikwissenschaftlerin und leitet am Wissenschaftszentrum Berlin für Sozialforschung eine Projektgruppe zum Thema Politikfeld Internet. Sie ist Ko-Direktorin des Alexander von Humboldt Instituts für Internet und Gesellschaft, wo sie den Bereich Policy und Governance leitet und Professorin für Internetpolitik an der Universität der Künste in Berlin. Ihre Forschungsinteressen richten sich auf die Regulierung des Internet und den Wandel des Urheberrechts. Von 2010 bis 2013 war sie Sachverständige in der Enquete-Kommission Internet und digitale Gesellschaft des deutschen Bundestags. Auf internationaler Ebene hat sie am UN Weltgipfel zur Informationsgesellschaft mitgewirkt und seit 2006 beteiligt sie sich im Internet Governance Forum.

speakers.name: Mikko Hypponen
speakers.biography: Mikko Hypponen is the Chief Research Officer for F-Secure. He has worked with F-Secure in Finland since 1991. Mr. Hypponen has led his team through the largest virus outbreaks in history. His team took down the world-wide network used by the Sobig.F worm. He was the first to warn the world about the Sasser outbreak, he named the infamous Storm Worm and he has done classified briefings on the operation of the Stuxnet worm. Apart from computer security issues, Mr. Hypponen enjoys collecting and restoring classic arcade video games and pinball machines from past decades.

speakers.name: Kristian  Müller
speakers.biography: Kristian has studied Electronic Engineering and Computational Engineering in Aalen and Berlin. Since 1997 he has been working as a software developer in different companies and started mixd.tv after graduating from Beuth Hochschule für Technik in Berlin.  Born and raised in Eastern Germany and having lived in Schwaben, Shanghai and Berlin Kristian has chosen Berlin as the place to be. As managing director at mixd.tv his mission is to make online media content accessible to all of us from any device.

speakers.name: Dr. Roger Fischer
speakers.biography: Grundwehrdienst, Volljurist nach Studium und Promotion in Bonn sowie Referendariat in Hamburg, seit 1996 Beamter des BMZ. Einsätze in den Referaten DEG/Ausfuhrgewährleistungen, Südliches Afrika, Haushalt und Bildung sowie 2007-2011 als Berater der deutschen Exekutivdirektorin bei der Weltbank. Seit 2012 Leiter des Referats "Internet, Soziale Medien, Bürgerkommunikation".

speakers.name: David Knight
speakers.biography: David Knight is co-founder and editor-in-chief of Silicon Allee, an English-language news website and community which has been covering the tech scene in Berlin since February 2011. Born in London, he gained a Masters in Newspaper Journalism at the Centre for Broadcasting and Journalism in Nottingham before landing his first reporting job at the Barnsley Chronicle, where he was later appointed chief reporter. He moved to Berlin at the beginning of 2007 and has since worked for some of Germany's biggest online news portals including Bild.de and Spiegel.de, and still contributes to a variety of different publications.

speakers.name: Petros  Theocharous
speakers.biography: Petros has been working in the software development industry for 7 years, being involved in finance, eBusiness and social projects. He studied Computer Science in Imperial College in London and since 2007 he has been gathering experiences in a number of different companies, like Goldman Sachs and the EU Agency for Trademarks.  Traveling is a way of life and after having lived in London, Spain, Greece and Germany, he is currently settled in Berlin and its lively startup scene. His latest passion is data aggregation.

speakers.name: Claudia Seifert
speakers.biography:
Claudia Seifert, M.A., geboren 1985, studierte von 2005 bis 2008 Medienforschung, Medienpraxis (BA) und von 2008 bis 2010 Angewandte Medienforschung (MA) am Institut für Kommunikationswissenschaft (IfK) der Technischen Universität Dresden. Während ihres Studiums war sie als wissenschaftliche Hilfskraft, Tutorin für Statistik und als Projektmitarbeiterin am IfK tätig. Von Januar bis September 2011 arbeitete sie in der Abteilung Medienforschung des Zweiten Deutschen Fernsehens in Mainz. Seit Oktober 2011 arbeitet sie wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin am Lehrstuhl von Prof. Hagen. Sie promoviert zum Themenbereich „Wirkung von Wirtschaftsberichterstattung“.

Forschungsschwerpunkte: Medienwirkungsforschung, insbesondere in wirtschaftlichen Zusammenhängen; Mediennutzung von Jugendlichen; empirische Methoden der Kommunikationsforschung.

speakers.name: Bruno Kramm
speakers.biography: Bruno Kramm, geboren 1967 in München, gründete 1989 eines der ersten Independentlabels für Gothic und EBM, Danse Macabre Records. Seit damals ist er auch mit seiner weltweit tourenden Szeneband Das Ich unterwegs und veröffentlichte zahlreiche Alben als Musiker und Produzent. Mit seinem Bandkollegen klagt er aktuell gegen die Verteiligungspraxis der GEMA. Neben seiner Parteizugehörigkeit bei den Piraten ist er auch Mitglied von Attac und dem Chaos Computer Club. Als Aktivist für die Reform des Urheberrechtes und Gegner intransparent verhandelter Handelsabkommen ist er sei 2011 als Beauftragter für das Urheberrecht der Piratenpartei Gast auf zahllosen Diskussionspodien und in TV- und Radiosendungen. 2012 arbeitete er als politischer Geschäftsführer des Landesverbandes Bayern, 2013 kandidierte er für die Bundestagswahl und aktuell ist er Listenkandidat für das europäische Parlament. Bereits 2011 setzte er sich auf den bundesweiten Protestveranstaltungen gegen das Freihandelsabkommen ACTA ein und ist auch jetzt als Gegner von TTIP Gast auf zahlreichen Veranstaltungen von Attac bis Collaboratory.

speakers.name: Il-Jin Atem Choi
speakers.biography: Il-Jin Atem Choi, 1981 in Moers geboren, lebt und arbeitet in Frankfort am Main. Von 2001 bis 2006 studierte er zunächst International Business Studies in Maastricht. Seit 2012 studiert er Kunst an der Städelschule bei Tobias Rehberger.

speakers.name: Friederike  Behrends
speakers.biography: Friederike Behrends ist seit Jahren in leitenden Positionen in Medienunternehmen tätig und verfügt über langjährige Erfahrung, insbesondere  in dem erfolgreichen Auf-, Um- oder Ausbau von digitalen Geschäften. Seit 2013 ist sie als Deutschland Managerin bei Magine und Rechtsanwältin bei SKW Schwarz Rechtsanwälte tätig. Von 2008 bis 2012 führte sie die Geschäfte der WDR mediagroup digital GmbH. Zuvor war Friederike Behrends von 2001 bis 2008 Mitglied der Geschäftsführung Bild.-T-Online.de AG & Co. KG

speakers.name: Alyona Asyamova
speakers.biography: Alyona is passionate about the social entrepreneurship sector and believes in its power to change the world. Originally from Tashkent, Uzbekistan, she has spent the last ten years living in Germany and holds a Master of Public Policy degree from the Hertie School of Governance. Prior to joining Impact Hub, she spent several years in the social sector--in various positions and projects--allowing her curiosity and desire to find solutions to bring her to like-minded organizations. Now, as the Global Impact Coordinator, Alyona coordinates the network’s efforts and strategy in measuring its impact and is responsible for various impact-related activities--including global surveys, impact reporting and research.

speakers.name: Ferda Ataman
speakers.biography: Ferda Ataman ist Politikwissenschaftlerin und Journalistin und lebt in Berlin. Seit 2012 leitet sie den “Mediendienst Integration”, eine Informationsplattform für Journalisten. Sie ist Mitbegründerin der Initiative „Neue deutsche Medienmacher“.

speakers.name: Johnny Haeusler
speakers.biography: Born in Berlin in 1964, Johnny Haeusler founded the award-winning weblog Spreeblick in 2002. He is also a radio DJ and talk show moderator and a member of post-punkrock band Plan B. Johnny has co-founded Germany's first blog ad network as well as one of Europe's most exciting social media conferences, re:publica. His highly recommended eBook "I live by the river!" is available on Amazon and for iOS devices. Unlike this text here, it is written in German. In November 2012, Johnny Haeusler released an internet book for parents called "Netzgemüse" (the book, not the parents), which he co-wrote with his wife Tanja. Together, the two also raise their sons and are therefore rarely bored.

speakers.name: Reem Almasri
speakers.biography: Reem is leading the Internet Research department at 7iber Dot Com, a hybrid media platform in Jordan. Working with a team, Reem is currently researching the governance model of the Internet in Jordan and the region, and conducting policy analysis influencing online content and infrastructure.

speakers.name: Nani Jansen
speakers.biography: Nani Jansen is a Dutch-qualified attorney who has been with MLDI since 2011. She oversees MLDI's regular and strategic litigation. Nani has acted in freedom of expression cases before national and international courts and human rights tribunals, including the European Court of Human Rights, the African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights, the East African Court of Justice, the UN Human Rights Committee, the UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention and the African Commission on Human and Peoples' Rights. Prior to joining MLDI, Nani worked as a litigation and arbitration attorney with De Brauw Blackstone Westbroek, a large law firm in the Netherlands. She also worked as a researcher on international peace and security for a non-profit organisation in New York and has experience working in the United Nations system. Nani graduated in civil law and public international law from the University of Amsterdam and specialised in human rights at Columbia Law School and the European University Institute. She has published on issues in international law, data protection, international arbitration and human rights. Nani speaks English, Dutch, French and Italian.

speakers.name: Jan Arpe
speakers.biography:
Jan Arpe is a project manager in the Global Economic Dynamics (GED) project at the Bertelsmann Foundation in Gütersloh, Germany. He has been in charge of developing GED VIZ, an award-winning visualization tool.

Some 24 years ago, Jan used to know the C64 ROM by heart. Six years later, he began to study mathematics in Mainz and Munich. Another ten years later, he got his PhD in theoretical computer science from the University of Lübeck and spent a post-doc year at the Department of Statistics at UC Berkeley, focusing on computational complexity theory and algorithmic learning. In 2008, he joined the Bertelsmann Foundation, working on demographic change, societal trust and global economics. Data visualization entered his life a good three years ago.

speakers.name: Faruq Hunter
speakers.biography:
Faruq Hunter is the founder and President of GeniusCo and its subsidy GeniusCorps. He has travelled and worked in over 60 countries servicing both the public and private sectors and is the Head Geek in charge connecting innovative startup communitties accross 180 countries with Geeks Gone Global. Mr. Hunter's primary focus is on using innovation as a foundation for developing systems to create, re-create, rejuvenate and sustain the concept of the rural town as efficient hubs for economic progress and global production.

Mr. Hunter has over 18 years experience in information Technology management and implementation and over 10 years experience in Global Business Development. Mr. Hunter utilizes bootstrapping as a preferred method of funding and has led four startups to profitability and exit through acquisition, including his first startup that was at the head of developing B2B E-commerce systems with Global 2000 companies when he was 21. As a preference he does not believe in debt as a system of sustainable economic growth

Faruq Hunter was a 13 year old high school graduate. He completed his first degree at the International University of Africa in Khartoum, Sudan. Mr. Hunter is primarily a self learner and self starter. After training himself to be a computer programmer, Business Analyst and Project Manager he held positions at Fortune 500 companies and has successfully lead projects with multi-million dollar budgets.

speakers.name: Delia Browne
speakers.biography:
Delia is one of the co-founders of Peer 2 Peer University ( P2PU) (www.p2pu.og ), an online disruptive open education initiative which is partnering with Creative Commons to build a School of Open( www.p2pu.org/en/schools/schol-of-open) and with the Open Knowlege Foundation building a school of Data and rebooting the School of Webcraft with Mozilla Foundation  amongst other exciting initiatives. Her popular P2PU course Copyright 4 Educators is now up to 6th iteration and has almost 95 % student retention rate, rare for any open online course.

Delia is a strong advocate of the open education movement and has actively participated in several international meetings on promoting open resources, technology and teaching practices in education. Delia works closely with Creative Commons and the Open Society Institue and others to  promote open education in Australia and throughout the world.

She is an extremely experienced copyright law policy lawyer and is currently the National Copyright Director of Australian Schools and Technical and Advcanced Education colleges(TAFEs). Delia manages the National Copyright Unit which provides specialist copyright advice to schools and the TAFE sector, implements smart copying initiatives and conducts negotiations with collecting societies on behalf of schools and TAFE institutes. In her current role- she led the successful 2005- 2006 education law reform efforts which led to the introduction of free educational use copyright exceptions. She is currently advocating for the introduction of fair use in response to the ALRC Review Copyright and the Digital Economy.

speakers.name: Fabian-Carlos Guhl
speakers.biography: Fabian-Carlos Guhl is MD-designate of FounderBus Africa. He studied Media and Communications and International Business in Berlin, London and Paris. He worked in communications strategy at the United Nations in NYC and the African Development Bank in Tunis and Abidjan. He was one of the first employees of DailyDeal, Europe’s largest Groupon competitor, which got acquired by Google. Fabian also worked for a leading ICT investor where he gained knowledge in scaling an e-commerce business model to 25 emerging markets in less than six months. Fabian co-founded several startups and companies. He is Director Germany at the European Young Innovators Forum.

speakers.name: Stephen LaPorte
speakers.biography: Stephen LaPorte is a free knowledge enthusiast. He has contributed to several open source software projects related to Wikipedia, including data visualization and analytical tools. He is interested in and writes about Wikipedia and online collaborative communities. Stephen is an attorney, working on cyberlaw issues, such as free licenses, anonymity, free speech, trademarks, and intermediary liability.

speakers.name: Friedrich Kitschelt
speakers.biography:
Dr. Friedrich Kitschelt ist seit Januar 2014 der beamtete Staatssekretär des Bundesministeriums für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (BMZ).

Von 2010 bis 2013 leitete er als Ministerialdirektor die Abteilung für „Afrika, Lateinamerika, Globale und Sektorale Aufgaben“, davor die Unterabteilung Asien und Südost-Europa. Dr. Friedrich Kitschelt diente dem BMZ unter anderem als Asien-Beauftragter, Sonderbeauftragter für Afghanistan und Europabeauftragter. Im Bundeskanzleramt leitete er das Referat Nord-Süd-Beziehungen und Menschenrechtspolitik der Bundesregierung.

Dr. Friedrich Kitschelt hat mehr als 12 Jahre im Ausland gearbeitet, unter anderem in Jamaika, Indien, Kenia und Belgien. In dieser Zeit war er u. a. langjährig für die Deutsche Gesellschaft für Technische Zusammenarbeit (GTZ) tätig und leitete an der deutschen Botschaft Nairobi sowie an der Deutschen Ständigen Vertretung bei der EU in Brüssel das Referat für Entwicklungspolitik.

Dr. Friedrich Kitschelt ist ausgebildeter Journalist und studierte Soziologie, Volkswirtschaftslehre und Jura an der Albertus-Magnus-Universität zu Köln und der Universität Bielefeld. Nach Diplom 1983 promovierte er 1985 zum Dr. rer. Soc. an der Universität Bielefeld.

speakers.name: Sönke Bartling
speakers.biography:
Für die meisten ist er ein Weltengänger. Neben seinen bodenständigen Erfahrungen, die er in der universitären Krankenversorgung als Oberarzt der Radiologie gesammelt hat, hat er sich als habilitierter Grundlagenforscher im Bereich der Computertomografie und Führung, minimal-invasiver Eingriffe betätigt. Einschliesslich Aufenthalten in Boston hat er verschiedene (Forschungs-) Kulturen kennengelernt und gemerkt, wie unterschiedlich Innovation und Forschungsleistung bewertet wird ... und welche Schwierigkeiten es gibt, innovative Konzepte und Entwicklungen zu kommunizieren, um zu setzen und dann auch noch regelrecht akkreditiert zu werden. Dabei hat er das wissenschaftliche Publikationssystem, das Patentsystem, die Venture capital-Kultur, internationale und nationale Germienarbeit und die modernen Technologietransfere erlebt.

Die disruptive (R)Evoluation zu Open Science oder Science 2.0 sieht er als Chance um die Experimentierfreude, Gerechtigkeit und Innovationslust in der Forschung zu erhalten und zu steigern. Das von ihm co-editierte Buchprojekt Opening Science (http://www.openingscience.org/get-the-book/) ist ein Beitrag zu der Aufklärung der heutigen Forschungswelt über diesen disruptiven Umschwung.

speakers.name: Michaela Lampert
speakers.biography:
*gebürtige Charlottenburgerin
*41 Jahre
*aktuell wohnungslos, insgesamt über 3 Jahre "draußen"*Mutter von drei Kindern
*Realschulabschluss
*Abgebrochene Ausbildung als technische Assistentin für Metallographie und physikalische Werkstoffanalyse
*ehrenamtliche Helferin in in der Wohnungslosentagesstätte Schöneberg (WoTa), des Unionhilfwerks

speakers.name: Jöran Muuß-Merholz
speakers.biography:
Jöran Muuß-Merholz ist Diplom-Pädagoge und betreibt mit einem kleinen Team die Agentur „J&K – Jöran und Konsorten“. 

Er arbeitet an den Schnittstellen zwischen Bildung & Lernen und Medien & Kommunikation. Insbesondere berät er Bildungseinrichtungen hinsichtlich der Frage, wie sie digitale Medien sinnvoll in ihrer Arbeit einsetzen können. 

Neben den beratenden und konzeptionellen Arbeiten der Agentur schreibt Jöran Muuß-Merholz für Fach- und Massenmedien, print und online. Jöran Muuß-Merholz hält Vorträge und gibt Workshops v.a. im deutschsprachigen Raum, aber zum Beispiel auch in Boston, Brno, Stockholm und Tokio. Weitere Texte, Termine und Projekte von Jöran Muuß-Merholz finden sich unter www.joeran.de

speakers.name: Tom Burck
speakers.biography:
Tomas Burck, Vice President Customer Communication

Im Jahr 2006 stieß  Tomas Burck als Leiter Kundensupport zu Gameforge und baute diesen Bereich maßgeblich auf.  

Seit 2012 verantwortet Burck in seiner Rolle als Vice President Customer Communication den Bereich Support,

das Community Management  sowie die Lokalisierung. 

Tomas Burck, Jahrgang 1974, studierte an der Fachhochschule Karlsruhe Wirtschaftsingenieurswesen.

Von 1998 bis 2006 arbeitete er bei der 1&1 Internet AG. Dort war er als Abteilungsleiter des Kundensupports tätig.

Ab 2004 übernahm er den Aufbau der 1&1 Philippines Inc., die er als General Manager leitete.

speakers.name: Paula Gutierrez
speakers.biography: Paula Gutiérrez is a Social innovator with wide experience as consultant and entrepreneur in sustainability, education, youth empowerment and community development in Colombia and Brasil. She is the Director of the Impact HUB Bogotá, the first center for social innovation in the region that offers a unique ecosystem of resources, inspiration, and collaboration to inspire, connect, and enable initiatives for a better world.  (http://bogota.impacthub.net). She holds a bachelor in Business Administration from Los Andes University.

speakers.name: Tariq Khokhar
speakers.biography: Tariq Khokhar is the World Bank's first data scientist and Open Data Evangelist. He's a mathematician and computer scientist who's interests lie where technology, transparency, poverty and data meet.

speakers.name: Julia Manske
speakers.biography: Julia Manske is currently working as a Researcher at stiftung neue verantwortung, a Berlin based Think Tank, where she analyses if and how digital innovation can be used to tackle societal challenges. Prior to this she was a Fellow at the Vodafone Institute for Society and Communications and was in charge of the area of “Knowledge Participation”. She also worked with Goodroot, a consultancy for evaluation and impact measurement in the non-profit sector. Julia is a social anthropologist; she studied in Munich and Mexico City.

speakers.name: Elton Rivas
speakers.biography: Elton Rivas is one of the driving forces behind Northeast Florida’s rapidly emerging entrepreneurial community.Rivas is also the visionary and a co-founder of One Spark, The World’s Crowdfunding Festival, which takes place in Jacksonville, Fla. each spring and expands globally to Berlin in September 2014. Rivas has founded or co-founded nearly a dozen successful companies, including CoWork Jax, Zero Confines, LLC, and most recently, KYN, an accelerator program that works side-by-side with startups. Rivas is also a triathlete, speaker and passionate human.

speakers.name: Aleksey Stemmer
speakers.biography:
I am a professional photographer specialized in wide variety of genres, mainly in: Nature, Animals, Transportation, Industrial.

Having a lot of hobbies from arts and music to biology resulted in diverse photographic interests. So I want to share my passion for photography and combine natural and artificial world through my perception and artistic view, as well as deliver high quality images. 

Another goal is to make unique photographs for the needs of such specialized market as zoos, universities and scientific expeditions.

My commercial work is constantly used by logistics and water treatment companies, news agencies, magazines and all kinds of advertisements.

Portfolio and other information: www.alexstemmer.com

speakers.name: Moritz Stefaner
speakers.biography:
Moritz Stefaner works as a “truth and beauty operator” on the crossroads of data visualization, information aesthetics and user interface design. With a background in Cognitive Science (B.Sc. with distinction, University of Osnabrueck) and Interface Design (M.A., University of Applied Sciences Potsdam), his work beautifully balances analytical and aesthetic aspects in mapping abstract and complex phenomena. He is especially interested in the visualization of large–scale human activity.

In the past, he has helped clients like the OECD, the World Economic Forum, Skype, dpa, FIFA, and Max Planck Research Society to find insights and beauty in large data sets. He was nominated for the Design Award of the Federal Republic of Germany and is a multiple winner of the Kantar Information is Beautiful awards. His work has been exhibited, among others, at Future Everything, SIGGRAPH, and ars electronica. He is part of the advisory board for the Places and Spaces Exhibit, and has been serving as a juror for the Malofiej award for information graphics, as reviewing expert for the Future and Emerging Technologies programme of the European Commission as well as advisor for the Digital Communities category of prix ars electronica. He has co-authored books for publishers like O’Reilly and Springer and has spoken and lectured on numerous occasions on the topic of information visualization.

speakers.name: Kaja Scheliga
speakers.biography:
Kaja Scheliga is a doctoral researcher at the HIIG in Berlin.

She is doing research in the field of open science.
